H0.text: Eroding the land by tilling is unnecessary with the new plant variety that has been genetically engineered to be insect-resistant, causing insects that eat it to die.

H1.text: Overproducing food crops is unnecessary with the new insect‑resistant gene‑inserted plant variety, because the plants kill insects that eat them.

H2.text: Removing weeds from crops is unnecessary with the new insect‑resistant plant variety that scientists developed by inserting a gene into crop plants, causing insects that eat the plant to die.

H3.text: Spraying plants with pesticides is unnecessary with the new plant variety that has been genetically engineered to be insect‑resistant, causing insects that eat it to die.

A4.text: The increase in insecticide use for the control of these secondary insects was far smaller than the reduction in total insecticide use due to Bt cotton adoption.

A5.text: more pesticide sprayings are needed over time to control emerging secondary pests, such as aphids, spider mites, and lygus bugs.

A6.text: Some insects populations have started to develop resistance towards delta endotoxin, with five resistant species found as of 2013.

A7.text: Delta endotoxins are a family of pore-forming toxins produced by Bacillus thuringiensis species of bacteria. They are useful for their insecticidal action and are the primary toxin produced by the genetically modified (GM) Bt maize/corn and other GM crops.

A8.text: Using Bt seeds means that farmers do not have to purchase insecticides, and then invest time, fuel, and equipment in applying them.

A9.text: Constant exposure to a toxin creates evolutionary pressure for pests resistant to that toxin.

A12.text: Pest‑tolerant crops such as soybeans may not warrant interventions unless the pests are numerous or rapidly increasing.

A13.text: Planthoppers now require pesticide doses 500 times greater than originally.

A14.text: Spraying of especially wheat and corn in Europe is believed to have caused an 80 per cent decline in flying insects, which in turn has reduced local bird populations by one to two thirds.

A15.text: They are more specific, and thus preserve beneficial insects and biodiversity in general.
